name: 古琴音樂與文化
description:
古琴，體現了最豐富的象徵意義，中國前現代文化中的獨奏樂器。在政治中佔有一席之地，社會和私人生活，樂器的藝術文化及其音樂實踐的演變。不時隨著西方殖民主義的經驗，儀器與整體，中國音樂文化面臨前所未有的挑戰而在回應不同的古琴音樂。演奏家以不同的方式接受變化，自聯合國教科文組織將古琴音樂藝術作為2003年人類口述和非物質遺產。
本課程向學生介紹古琴音樂實踐的基礎知識，包括基礎表演技巧，演奏符號，詞彙美學範疇和結構組織，盡可能地將古琴置於其多元化的歷史背景中，也指導學生從各類文獻中觀察和反思現代音樂藝術的變化。
最重要的是，該課程提供聽覺，審美，通過實踐古琴音樂，鼓勵學生擴大他們的敏感度，並將這種經驗擴展到另一方音樂實踐創造性地。學生應該積極參與課堂，並在整個學期中始終如一地完成課程作業。
goals: 了解古琴在音樂和文化上的知識
了解歷史和現代語境中的古琴藝術
培養批判性及獨立思維以作為民族音樂學領域研究的基礎

week 1: Introductionsp.p1 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica}

  

week 2: Basics: Performance Techniques and Notation

  

week 3-4: Performance Workshop (1); Qin Poetry Appreciation

  

week 5: Notation Handbooks (琴譜), In-Depth Reading of Notation Handbooks

  

week 6: Repertoire (1); Landscape Poetics, Essay Review (1)

  - Ronald Egan: “The Controversy Over Music and 'Sadness' and Changing Conceptions of The Qin in Middle Period China.”

  - Project Due: Sound Meditation

  

week 7: Repertoire (2); Mode and Formal Structure, Essay Review (1)

  - John Latartara: “Theoretical Approacches toward Qin Analysis: Water and Clouds over Xiao Xiang.”

  

week 8: Guest speaker (Discussion)

  

week 9: Qin Players: Musicality, Love, and Activism; New Compositions, Oral Reports and Discussion (1)

  - Joseph S. C. Lam: “Analyses and Interpretations of Chinese Seven-String Zither

  - Music: The Case of the Lament of Empress Chen.”

  

week 10: Ear of Qin and Aurality; Heart of Qin and Intangible Heritage Wave/Craze, Oral Reports and Discussion (2)

  - Robert Hans van Gulik: The Lore of the Chinese Lute: an Essay in the Ideology of the Ch’in

  

week 11: Interpretation Styles: the Case Lament of Empress Chen (長⾨門怨); Oral Reports and Discussion (3)

  - Project Due: Review Essay

  

week 12: Oral Presentation and Discussion Participation 1, Final Project Discussion

  

week 13: Oral Presentation and Discussion Participation 2, Oral Presentation and Discussion (1)

  

week 14: Oral Presentation and Discussion Participation 2, Oral Presentation and Discussion (2)

  

week 15~18: Final Project Due
